abstract.text: An object that provides an animated transition between a layer’s states.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: You can transition between a layer’s states by creating and adding a
object to it. The default transition is a cross fade, but you can specify different effects from a set of predefined transitions.
The following code shows how you can transition between the two states of a
. When the layer is first created, its
is set to red and its
object is created and added to
, and the state of the layer is changed so that its background color is blue and its rendered text reads
The end result is that the push transition animates the red state from left to right with the blue state entering the scene from the left.

abstract.text: Render, compose, and animate visual elements.
An interface that allows instances to respond to actions triggered by a Core Animation layer change.
The abstract superclass for animations in Core Animation.
Methods your app can implement to respond when animations start and stop.
An object that provides basic, single-keyframe animation capabilities for a layer property.
An object that provides keyframe animation capabilities for a layer object.
The background color of the receiver. Animatable.
Methods that model a hierarchical timing system, allowing objects to map time between their parent and local time.
An abstract subclass for creating animations that manipulate the value of layer properties.
An animation that applies a spring-like force to a layer’s properties.
A layer that provides simple text layout and rendering of plain or attributed strings.
The text to be rendered by the receiver.
An object that provides an animated transition between a layer’s states.
Indicates the end point of the receiver as a fraction of the entire transition.
An optional Core Image filter object that provides the transition.
Indicates the start point of the receiver as a fraction of the entire transition.
Specifies an optional subtype that indicates the direction for the predefined motion-based transitions.
Specifies the predefined transition type.
An object that provides a flexible method of defining animated transformations.
These constants specify the direction of motion-based transitions. They are used with the
property.
These constants specify the transition types that can be used with the
property.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
A protocol that objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables encoding and decoding in a manner that is robust against object substitution attacks.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
